bug.author: XiaotianM
bug.description: Hello, I have set up the Labelme. However, it seems to only support the filetype like *.b'bmp'... So I donâ€˜t know how to use it. Besides, when I use your example codes, it has gone wrong. Problem presented as follows: "Error saving label data, a bytes-like object is required, not 'str' " Can you tell me how to solve this problem? Thank you

comments.comment: Please specify your platform and the version of labelme and pyqt
Win10 platform, Anaconda, and I install labelme by conda create --name=labelme python=3.5, and others are the same as your guidance
Could you please paste below command's output? <denchmark-code>conda list pyqt | grep pyqt </denchmark-code>

pyqt 5.6.0 py35_0 I think pyqt is OK, the labelme GUI is ok, but I can not load the image. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29722350/29807475-c341c2ec-8cc6-11e7-8802-8bf9dace31b8.png></denchmark-link>
I can not load my image, too.
Confirmed. It is caused by the difference of string betwee python2 and 3. Will be fixed via <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro/labelme/pull/20>#20</denchmark-link> .
